programName: Materials Science & Engineering / Mechanical Engineering Joint Major (B.S.)
fullProgramDescription: The joint major in Materials Science & Engineering and Mechanical Engineering is an interdisciplinary program that combines the study of materials properties and behavior with the principles of mechanical engineering. Students in this program gain a deep understanding of the relationships between materials, mechanical systems, and engineering applications.
shortProgramDescription: The Materials Science & Engineering / Mechanical Engineering Joint Major provides students with a comprehensive education in materials science and mechanical engineering, preparing them for careers at the intersection of these fields.
classHighlights: The program includes foundational courses in materials science and mechanical engineering, such as Introduction to Materials Science and Engineering (MATSCI 45), Mechanics of Materials (MECENG 105), and Thermodynamics (MECENG 40).
Students take advanced courses in materials properties, characterization, and processing, as well as mechanical systems, design, and analysis.
Courses in mathematics and physics, such as Calculus (MATH 1A-1B) and Physics (PHYSICS 7A-7B), provide a theoretical foundation for the program.
Students also complete laboratory courses, such as Materials Science and Engineering Laboratory (MATSCI 111) and Mechanical Engineering Laboratory (MECENG 108).
The program includes a range of electives, allowing students to tailor their education to their interests and career goals.
learningOutcomes: Apply knowledge of materials science and mechanical engineering to solve complex engineering problems.
Design and analyze mechanical systems and materials processing techniques.
Characterize and understand the properties and behavior of various materials.
Communicate technical concepts effectively in written and oral form.
Work effectively in teams to solve engineering problems.
additionalInformation: Students must complete the requirements for both the Materials Science & Engineering and Mechanical Engineering majors, with some overlap in coursework. The program is administered jointly by the departments of Materials Science & Engineering and Mechanical Engineering.
